case_vignette: A 40-year-old chronic smoker presents to the office complaining of a cough and pleuritic chest pain. He also has had pain in his right shoulder for the past 2 weeks. He denies fever, night sweats, but has noticed a 2.2 kg (5 lb) weight loss in the last month. He has no recent history of travel. Past medical history is unremarkable. On cardiopulmonary examination, bilateral velcro-like crackles are auscultated in the upper to middle lung fields, with normal heart sounds. There is a 3 x 3 cm swelling on the right shoulder with a normal range of motion and intact sensation. 5/5 muscular strength in all extremities is noted. Chest X-ray reveals bilateral nodular opacities in the upper lung lobes and a lytic lesion on the right humeral head. Electron microscopy of the lung biopsy shows the following.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having a cough and sharp chest pain when I breathe in, along with a persistent pain in my right shoulder for the past couple of weeks.
How old are you?
I'm 40 years old.
Do you have a history of smoking or exposure to environmental toxins?
Yes, I've been smoking for a long time.
Do you have a family history of lung cancer or any other cancers?
My past medical history is unremarkable, so no significant family history was mentioned.
Are you currently taking any medications?
I haven't mentioned taking any medications.
Got it. Have you experienced any unexplained weight loss or loss of appetite recently?
I have noticed a weight loss of about 2.2 kg (5 lbs) in the last month.
**Final Diagnosis:** Lung Cancer
